etymology.interpretation: Combines “fresh” and “milk” to refer to milk that is recently obtained and not long stored. Often contrasts with 常温奶 or 奶粉.
etymology.simplification: 鮮→鲜 by simplifying the 魚 component to 鱼; 奶 unchanged. Fewer strokes and consistent with radical simplifications.

examples.chinese: 我早上喝一杯鲜奶(我早上喝一杯鮮奶)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǎoshang hē yì bēi xiān nǎi.
examples.english: I drink a glass of fresh milk in the morning.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢用鲜奶泡咖啡(我喜歡用鮮奶泡咖啡)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan yòng xiān nǎi pào kāfēi.
examples.english: I like to make coffee with fresh milk.

examples.chinese: 这家超市每天都有鲜奶供应(這家超市每天都有鮮奶供應)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā chāoshì měitiān dōu yǒu xiān nǎi gōngyìng.
examples.english: This supermarket has fresh milk available every day.
